title: Windows newline issues
body:
Apparently even on Windows, Stata logs don't use `
` for every line break. This is the `repr` of the result of `reg price mpg` on Windows. The two characters after this segment of text is `
`, but each line of the regression results is ended just by `
`. The `eol` entry in `expect` is `r'?
'`, but apparently the pexpect buffer is large enough that it finds the ending `
` before the intermediate `
`s. 

```
'      Source |       SS           df       MS      Number of obs   =        74
-------------+----------------------------------   F(1, 72)        =     20.26
       Model |   139449474         1   139449474   Prob > F        =    0.0000
    Residual |   495615923        72  6883554.48   R-squared       =    0.2196
-------------+----------------------------------   Adj R-squared   =    0.2087
       Total |   635065396        73  8699525.97   Root MSE        =    2623.7
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
       price |      Coef.   Std. Err.      t    P>|t|     [95% Conf. Interval]
-------------+----------------------------------------------------------------
         mpg |  -238.8943   53.07669    -4.50   0.000    -344.7008   -133.0879
       _cons |   11253.06   1170.813     9.61   0.000     8919.088    13587.03
------------------------------------------------------------------------------'
```
